turns.content: You're a travel planning expert who needs to prepare a detailed 2 week day to day agenda for a young couple travelling to Tanzania tomorrow morning. They like cocktails, clubbing, museums, good food, music, and maybe ocean stuff. Climbing mountains, nature and hiking is a big no no. You need to take weather forecasts, price, google reviews, time of day, and proximity into account. For every activity or place to go to on the agenda, you need to describe the reason behind your choice and why you think they'd enjoy it. Include all hours of the day in the itinerary so that it's very clear what they need to do throughout the day. GO

Day 1:
Morning:

* Arrive in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania
* Check in at the Slipway Hotel (rated 4.2/5 on Google Reviews) - located near the ocean with excellent views, and a variety of restaurants and bars

Afternoon:

* 12:30 pm: Lunch at The Waterfront Sunset Restaurant & Beach Bar (rated 4.3/5) - offers a great seafood selection and a beautiful view of the ocean
* 2:00 pm: Visit the National Museum (rated 4.1/5) - provides a glimpse into Tanzania's rich history and culture

Evening:

* 7:00 pm: Dinner at Chops N Hops (rated 4.4/5) - a fusion of local and international cuisine
* 9:00 pm: Enjoy cocktails and live music at Samaki Samaki (rated 4.2/5) - a trendy bar that offers a variety of cocktails and hosts live performances

Day 2:
Morning:

* 10:00 am: Brunch at Epi d'Or (rated 4.4/5) - a popular bakery and cafe with an extensive menu

Afternoon:

* 12:00 pm: Visit Village Museum (rated 4.2/5
Can you include addresses and the distance/time needed to move from on place to the next on the agenda?

Day 1:
Morning:

* Arrive in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania
* Check in at the Slipway Hotel (rated 4.2/5 on Google Reviews) - located near the ocean with excellent views, and a variety of restaurants and bars. Address: Slipway Road, Msasani Peninsula, Dar es Salaam.

Afternoon:

* 12:30 pm: Lunch at The Waterfront Sunset Restaurant & Beach Bar (rated 4.3/5) - offers a great seafood selection and a beautiful view of the ocean. Address: Slipway Road, Msasani Peninsula, Dar es Salaam. (Walking distance from the hotel, about 5 minutes)
* 2:00 pm: Visit the National Museum (rated 4.1/5) - provides a glimpse into Tanzania's rich history and culture. Address: Shabaan Robert St, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 25 minutes by car)

Evening:

* 7:00 pm: Dinner at Chops N Hops (rated 4.4/5) - a fusion of local and international cuisine. Address: Slipway Road, Msasani Peninsula, Dar es Salaam. (Walking distance from the hotel, about 5 minutes)
* 9:00 pm: Enjoy cocktails and live music at Samaki Samaki (rated 4.2/5) - a trendy bar that offers a variety of cocktails and hosts live performances. Address: Haile Selassie Rd, Oysterbay, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 15 minutes by car)

Day 2:
Morning:

* 10:00 am: Brunch at Epi d'Or (rated 4.4/5) - a popular bakery and cafe with an extensive menu. Address: Slipway Road, Msasani Peninsula, Dar es Salaam. (Walking distance from the hotel, about 5 minutes)

Afternoon:

* 12:00 pm: Visit Village Museum (rated 4.2/5) - showcasing traditional Tanzanian life through authentic huts and cultural performances. Address: Ali Hassan Mwinyi Rd, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 20 minutes by car)
* 3:00 pm: Head to Coco Beach (Oysterbay Beach) - relax by the ocean and enjoy the sunset. Address: Toure Dr, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 15 minutes by car)

Evening:

* 7:00 pm: Dinner at Cape Town Fish Market (rated 4.1/5) - a seafood restaurant offering a mix of South African and Japanese cuisine. Address: Haile Selassie Rd, Oysterbay, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 10 minutes by car)
* 9:00 pm: Experience the vibrant nightlife at High Spirit Lounge Bar (rated 4.2/5) - a rooftop bar with great cocktails, a DJ, and a dance floor. Address: Haile Selassie Rd, Oysterbay, Dar es Salaam. (Walking distance from the restaurant, about 5 minutes)
It's a two week long holiday...you gave me two days

Apologies for that, here's the full 2-week itinerary:

Day 3:
Morning:

* 10:00 am: Breakfast at Slipway Hotel
* 11:30 am: Visit Tingatinga Arts Cooperative Society (rated 4.4/5) - explore Tanzanian art and purchase unique souvenirs. Address: Haile Selassie Rd, Oysterbay, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 15 minutes by car)

Afternoon:

* 1:00 pm: Lunch at Mediterraneo Restaurant (rated 4.4/5) - a beautiful Italian restaurant by the beach. Address: Toure Dr, Kawe Beach, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 20 minutes by car)
* 3:00 pm: Take a boat tour of the Dar es Salaam Marine Reserve (rated 4.5/5) - enjoy the ocean views and spot marine life. (Duration: 3 hours)

Evening:

* 7:30 pm: Dinner at Mamboz Restaurant (rated 4.5/5) - indulge in delicious Tanzanian BBQ dishes. Address: Morogoro Rd, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 35 minutes by car)
* 9:30 pm: Drinks and dancing at Elements Club (rated 4.1/5) - one of the most popular nightclubs in Dar es Salaam. Address: Haile Selassie Rd, Oysterbay, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 20 minutes by car)

Day 4:
Morning:

* 10:00 am: Breakfast at Slipway Hotel
* 12:00 pm: Visit Mwenge Woodcarvers Market (rated 4.1/5) - discover local handicrafts and souvenirs. Address: Sam Nujoma Rd, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 30 minutes by car)

Afternoon:

* 2:00 pm: Lunch at Ristorante Bella Napoli (rated 4.4/5) - enjoy authentic Italian cuisine. Address: Chole Rd, Masaki, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 20 minutes by car)
* 4:00 pm: Relax at the hotel pool or enjoy water sports at the Slipway Hotel

Evening:

* 7:30 pm: Dinner at 305 Karafuu (rated 4.6/5) - offering a mix of African, Indian, and European dishes. Address: Karafuu St, Kinondoni, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 25 minutes by car)
* 9:30 pm: Cocktails at Karambezi Café (rated 4.6/5) - a seafront cafe with an impressive cocktail menu. Address: Toure Dr, Sea Cliff Hotel, Dar es Salaam. (Approximately 20 minutes by car)

Days 5-7: Zanzibar Trip

* Fly to Zanzibar (approximately 20 minutes) and check in at Zanzi Resort (rated 4.5/5), located on the west coast of Zanzibar, offering private beach access and ocean views.

Day 5:

* Explore Stone Town, visit the House of Wonders, and enjoy a guided Spice Tour
* Dinner at Emerson Spice Tea House Restaurant (rated 4.7/5)

Day 6:

* Day trip to Prison Island (Changuu) for snorkeling and meeting giant tortoises
* Dinner at Forodhani Gardens Night Market

Day 7:

* Relax at Nungwi Beach on the north coast of Zanzibar
* Dinner at Langi Langi Beach Bungalows Restaurant (rated 4.5/
